intro: Gomphostemma luzonense, commonly known as the Luzon moonseed, is a climbing vine native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by elongated, narrow fruits. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
